value.name: Seven Maine legislators out of assignments after refusing to wear mask in State House
value.description: The Portland Press Herald and the Associated Press reported seven legislators tried to enter the State House without COVID face coverings, defying house rules.

video.name: Seven Maine legislators removed from committee seats after entering State House without face coverings, according to reports

value.name: 7 conservative Maine lawmakers booted from committees after mask-rule protest
value.description: Biddeford, made the decision to punish the lawmakers after a video released by Rep. Laurel Libby, R-Auburn, showed her and six others entering the main lobby of the capitol building unmasked.

value.name: Lawmakers lose committee assignments after breaking State House mask rule
value.description: Seven conservative legislators, arguing that Gov. Mills has lifted the mask mandate, entered the building without wearing the face coverings required by the Legislative Council in a ruling last week.

value.name: Maine lawmakers could head back to the State House soon
value.description: John Bott, a spokesman for House Republicans, on Friday reiterated the caucus position that the Legislature should return to doing its business before the public in the State House as soon as possible. "For months, House Republicans have called for safely ...
